Description:
Join us for an epic journey through decades of Microsoft history. In this nostalgic look back, three longtime Microsoft veterans - KC Lemson (27 years, retired), Raymond Chen (33 years), and Larry Osterman (41 years) - share their favorite stories—from the early days of MS-DOS and Windows 95 to quirky product features, Easter eggs, and viral icons like Ninja Cat.

You’ll hear about:

The infamous Windows 95 launch and its “Special Edition” box How a tiny Snipping Tool feature became a top Windows 10 favorite Debugging the Pinball game running at 1 million FPS Bedlam DL3: The original “Reply All” storm Ninja Cat’s rise from a slide deck to a global phenomenon T-shirt contests, goat horns, and even a horse named Hanson at the Kentucky Derby

If you love tech history, engineering war stories, and the human side of building iconic products, this is the ultimate throwback.
